item.title: Surface Armatures
item.description: These illustrations are a continuation of the aesthetic language I employed for the "City Settlement" series, except where the site for those were vast abandoned landscapes, the site for these are dilapidated urban industrial facades. The crumbling and decayed surfaces of these buildings provide the foundation for a variety of intervening architectural devices
item.content:encoded: These illustrations are a continuation of the aesthetic language I employed for the "City Settlement" series, except where the site for those were vast abandoned landscapes, the site for these are dilapidated urban industrial facades. The crumbling and decayed surfaces of these buildings provide the foundation for a variety of intervening architectural devices

item.title: Grid Visualization & Remote App
item.description: GRID is an interactive multi-touch sound visualization for the band Mathon and the ZKM AppArtAward 2011. Created for live events, the application consists of a desktop version for realtime graphic visualization of music created using Processing and also an iOS version for interacting with the Processing app created using openFrameworks.
item.content:encoded: GRID is an interactive multi-touch sound visualization for the band Mathon and the ZKM AppArtAward 2011. Created for live events, the application consists of a desktop version for realtime graphic visualization of music created using Processing and also an iOS version for interacting with the Processing app created using openFrameworks.

item.title: The Beauty Of A Second
item.description: The Beauty Of A Second is a short-film contest presented by Wim Wenders, born to celebrate the invention of the chronograph 190 years ago. The task of Montblanc's initiative is to capture beauty in a one-second-long video.
item.content:encoded: The Beauty Of A Second is a short-film contest presented by Wim Wenders, born to celebrate the invention of the chronograph 190 years ago. The task of Montblanc's initiative is to capture beauty in a one-second-long video.

item.title: Digital Alphabet in Stone
item.description: Digital Alphabet in stone Dom Hans van der Laan (Leiden, 1904-1991) was a Dutch architect and Benedictine monk. After only a few years of architecture study Van der Laan developed a system of ratio principles based on the theory of the plastic number, which he invented. Using this theory Dom Hans van der Laan not only designed buildings, he also developed a typeface: the Alphabet in stone. This typeface is based on the Roman carved stone capitals that were used in the first century AD. This exclusive typeface is now digitized and modernized. The complete font family contains four members: the basic figures from which the letters are created, a version with guides and contour lines, the regular font and the typeface showing the axes. By digitizing this typeface, cutting letters in stone is simplified as it enables stonemasons to print directly onto a medium. It saves a great deal of time because the letters do not need to be drawn by hand anymore. Modern techniques, like milling and laser cutting, are now possible too.
item.content:encoded: Digital Alphabet in stone Dom Hans van der Laan (Leiden, 1904-1991) was a Dutch architect and Benedictine monk. After only a few years of architecture study Van der Laan developed a system of ratio principles based on the theory of the plastic number, which he invented. Using this theory Dom Hans van der Laan not only designed buildings, he also developed a typeface: the Alphabet in stone. This typeface is based on the Roman carved stone capitals that were used in the first century AD. This exclusive typeface is now digitized and modernized. The complete font family contains four members: the basic figures from which the letters are created, a version with guides and contour lines, the regular font and the typeface showing the axes. By digitizing this typeface, cutting letters in stone is simplified as it enables stonemasons to print directly onto a medium. It saves a great deal of time because the letters do not need to be drawn by hand anymore. Modern techniques, like milling and laser cutting, are now possible too.

item.title: The Pencil-Sharpener-Ventilator
item.description: The Pencil-Sharpener-Ventilator is a project I've done with friends just for fun during my holidays. Together with Sabrina Mairinger, I renovated an old ventilator from my grandpa. We took it apart into its individual parts. Cleaned, sanded and sprayed it matt white. The switch was ugly, so we took it off and filled the gap with polyester resin. With the rotation of the ventilator we've needed a special sharpener for left-hander only. We saw it to the correct length, sanded and sprayed it again. The hardest part was to glue the pencil sharpener exactly to the right position. Otherwise it has a unbalance. At the end we mounted a new power cable with a new switch and screwed all other parts together and there it was: The Pencil-Sharpener-Ventilator. Special thanks to Michele Di Dio he took the pictures. Johannes Brugger he filmed & helped cutting. And Sabrina Mairinger she helped renovating and was our model in the movie. You can buy this unique product of far future for just 400,000 $. ;)
item.content:encoded: The Pencil-Sharpener-Ventilator is a project I've done with friends just for fun during my holidays. Together with Sabrina Mairinger, I renovated an old ventilator from my grandpa. We took it apart into its individual parts. Cleaned, sanded and sprayed it matt white. The switch was ugly, so we took it off and filled the gap with polyester resin. With the rotation of the ventilator we've needed a special sharpener for left-hander only. We saw it to the correct length, sanded and sprayed it again. The hardest part was to glue the pencil sharpener exactly to the right position. Otherwise it has a unbalance. At the end we mounted a new power cable with a new switch and screwed all other parts together and there it was: The Pencil-Sharpener-Ventilator. Special thanks to Michele Di Dio he took the pictures. Johannes Brugger he filmed & helped cutting. And Sabrina Mairinger she helped renovating and was our model in the movie. You can buy this unique product of far future for just 400,000 $. ;)

item.title: Sarpi Border Checkpoint
item.description: The customs checkpoint is situated at the Georgian border to Turkey, at the shore of the Black Sea. With its cantilevering terraces, the tower is used as a viewing platform, with multiple levels overlooking the water and the steep part of the coastline. In addition to the regular customs facilities, the structure also houses a cafeteria, staff rooms and a conference room. The building welcomes visitors to Georgia, representing the progressive upsurge of the country.
item.content:encoded: The customs checkpoint is situated at the Georgian border to Turkey, at the shore of the Black Sea. With its cantilevering terraces, the tower is used as a viewing platform, with multiple levels overlooking the water and the steep part of the coastline. In addition to the regular customs facilities, the structure also houses a cafeteria, staff rooms and a conference room. The building welcomes visitors to Georgia, representing the progressive upsurge of the country.

item.title: Movium Booklet illustration
item.description: I was asked to illustrate a small booklet for Movium - the Centre for Urban Public Space at the Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences. The illustration had to work as cover (without any texts) and show Movium's all business areas which should be used for different chapters in the booklet. The final Illustrator image contained 156,585 anchor points and 26.727 paths. | Movium | 2011 Moviums objective is to identify and communicate relevant knowledge about the meaning of the public space to people in our cities and towns. Through gathering, accumulating and systematising knowledge, articulating questions and making generalisations based on experience, Movium aims to increase understanding of the significance of the public space to social development in general and to human welfare and well-being.
item.content:encoded: I was asked to illustrate a small booklet for Movium - the Centre for Urban Public Space at the Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences. The illustration had to work as cover (without any texts) and show Movium's all business areas which should be used for different chapters in the booklet. The final Illustrator image contained 156,585 anchor points and 26.727 paths. | Movium | 2011 Moviums objective is to identify and communicate relevant knowledge about the meaning of the public space to people in our cities and towns. Through gathering, accumulating and systematising knowledge, articulating questions and making generalisations based on experience, Movium aims to increase understanding of the significance of the public space to social development in general and to human welfare and well-being.
